intro: Physedra elegans, commonly known as the elegant physedra, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a dry, capsule that contains numerous small seeds. Physedra elegans is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to various soil types.
